About

 

The Faculty Affairs division of the Provost's Office is responsible for implementation of University policy regarding appointments and promotions, salary setting, leaves, endowed chair appointments, appeals, and other matters of an academic nature.
More about us


 
Recent News From Faculty Senate

 

The elected Senate is the centerpiece of academic governance at Stanford and the main instrument for faculty participation in setting policy and making decisions on academic affairs. The work of the Senate and its committees - the Steering Committee, the Committee on Committees, and the Planning and Policy Board - is supported by the Academic Secretary's Office.
More information





 

 
Important Information
Online Harassment Resource:
A new website (SUNet ID protected) has been created that provides guidance, support, and resources for faculty and academic staff-teaching affected by toxic online behaviors such as insults, stalking, threats of bodily harm, and sexual harassment.
Pay Transparency Law Compliance
In this section, you will find guidelines and other information for Faculty and Academic Staff/Other Teaching Staff job postings as mandated under California’s Pay Transparency law (S.B. 1162), which went into effect January 1, 2023 and requires Stanford to include pay ranges for every job posted.
General Guidelines for Compliance with California’s Pay Transparency Law

Faculty Affairs Updates










 
Provost’s January 19, 2022 Announcement of Additional COVID-Related Support for Eligible Junior Academic Council Faculty
 On January 19, 2022, the Provost announced additional measures to assist junior faculty members in the Academic Council Professoriate.

AST/OTS Appointment and Reappointment Letters Updated
 The Appointment and Reappointment Letters for Academic Staff-Teaching and Other Teaching Staff have been updated to reflect the new Covid hiring requirements.

Long Form Face Page Update
 A new long form face page has been posted to the form in Appendix B of the Faculty Handbook.


September 01, 2021








 
Change in Line Name - Medical Center Line/University Medical Line
 Effective June 14, 2021, following action by the Faculty Senate and the Board of Trustees, the Medical Center Line (MCL) has been renamed the University Medical Line (UML).


June 14, 2021








 
Updated Language for Referee Solicitations for Junior Faculty Tenure Decisions
